import-python 2.1.0 documentation
previous | next | index

Random¶

seed(number, string, boolean)¶

Set the seed of the random number generator.

Arguments

  • boolean (number, string,()) – seed - the seed

Returns

[number] the seed

random()¶

Return a random number between 0 and 1.

Returns

[number] a random number between 0 and 1

randint(number)¶

Generate a random integer beteen start and end.

Arguments

  • number – start - the start of the range (inclusive)

  • number – end - the end of the range (inclusive)

Returns

[number] a random number between start and end

randrange(number)¶

Return a random integer between start and end with optional step.

Arguments

  • number – stop - the stop value

  • number – start - the start value

  • number – step - the step value

Returns

[number] a random number between start and stop

choice(iterable)¶

Return a random element from a non-empty iterable.

Arguments

  • iterable – iterable - the iterable

Returns

[object] a random element from the iterable

choices(iterable, number)¶

Return k random elements from a non-empty iterable.

Arguments

  • iterable – iterable - the iterable

  • number – k - the number of elements to return

Returns

[List] a list of k random elements from the iterable

sample(iterable, number)¶

Return k elements from a non-empty iterable without replacement.

Arguments

  • iterable – iterable

  • number – k

Returns

[List] a list of k elements from the iterable

shuffle(iterable)¶

Shuffle an array in place.

Arguments

  • iterable – iterable

Returns

[List] a shiffled list of the elements of the iterable

uniform(number)¶

Return a number between start and end.

Arguments

  • number – start

  • number – end

Returns

[number] a random number between start and end
